board.name: jointio
board.test: Use a multi-meter to beep the connection between ground and all of the ground cage-clamps. Are they all connected?
Apply power to the board. Check it doesn't draw too much current.
Connect to the MSP430. Can it be programmed?
Can you read the correct board identity over I2C?
Does the I2C LED flash during I2C activity?
Measure the voltage on each of the 3.3V cage clamps. Are they all connected to 3.3V?
Connect ground to all inputs. Do they all read zero?

Keeping all other inputs connected to ground, connect 12V followed by 1.5V to each input in turn. Make sure the supply used for these references has a sensible current limit set (e.g. 50mA). Read the inputs over I2C for each configuration. For 12V, the reading should be 1023. For 1.5V, the reading should be approximately 465.
Do each of the input LEDs work.

Go through each of the outputs in turn. Set that output high, and all others low. For each configuration, check the voltages on the output cage-clamps are correct. Check the output LEDs are also correct.
